definitions: An official agreement intended to resolve a dispute or conflict.
A formal arrangement made between the parties to a lawsuit in order to resolve it, especially out of court.
A place, typically one which has previously been uninhabited, where people establish a community.
The process of establishing a settlement or settlements.
The action of allowing or helping people to establish settlements.
An arrangement whereby property passes to a succession of people as dictated by the settlor.
The property given under a settlement.
The action or process of settling an account.
Subsidence of the ground or a structure built on it.
